[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The European Train Control System (ERTMS/ETCS) document defines requirements to ensure safety, reliability, and interoperability in railway operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ERTMS/ETCS focuses on operational requirements, excluding technical specifications for components not implemented in SRS 2.3.0.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ERTMS/ETCS interfaces with national control systems for compatibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ERTMS/ETCS provides a DMI for operational interactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ERTMS/ETCS integrates with balises, loops, and radio systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ERTMS/ETCS operates with standardized software for train control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ERTMS/ETCS supports continuous and intermittent data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ERTMS/ETCS stores operational and national values persistently.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ERTMS/ETCS manages train supervision, level transitions, and faults.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ERTMS/ETCS is customizable for national needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ERTMS/ETCS integrates with RBC and interlocking systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ERTMS/ETCS monitors train movement, calculates speed profiles, and manages emergency functions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ERTMS/ETCS is designed for drivers, operators, and maintainers with varying expertise.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ERTMS/ETCS is dependent on trackside and onboard equipment compatibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ERTMS/ETCS relies on RBC communication, trackside installations, and national values.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Balise: Device for track-to-train data transmission.
Movement Authority: Permission for a train to proceed.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall support data exchange with national control systems.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The DMI shall display operational states and speed profiles.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall manage transitions between operational levels (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall execute emergency brake functions.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The DMI shall provide clear and intuitive displays for drivers.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process state transitions within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime under normal conditions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store operational and fault data for at least 24 hours.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall enable data retrieval for analysis.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with ETCS interoperability standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to European railway safety regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall operate within latency limits for commands.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall provide feedback within 1 second for user actions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate operational functions, fault handling, and compatibility with trackside systems.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Includes manuals, user guides, and regulatory references.
[SEC] 5. References: ETCS Technical Manual, ERA Safety Standards, and National Rail Guidelines.
